data.enText: to say that sth is not true

data.chText: 否认某种说法 / 指控 / 指责
data.enText: to deny a claim/a charge/an accusation

data.chText: 发言人对那些报道不置可否。
data.enText: The spokesman refused either to confirm or deny the reports.

data.chText: 无可否认，如果行动快一点，本来是救得了他们的。
data.enText: There's no denying (the fact) that quicker action could have saved them.
He denies attempting to murder his wife.
She denied (that) there had been any cover-up.

data.chText: 无可否认，我们必须投入更多的资源来解决这个问题。
data.enText: It can't be denied that we need to devote more resources to this problem.
to refuse to admit or accept sth

data.chText: 她矢口否认知晓此事的任何情况。
data.enText: She denied all knowledge of the incident.

data.chText: 这个部门拒绝为所发生的事承担责任。
data.enText: The department denies responsibility for what occurred.
to refuse to allow sb to have sth that they want or ask for

data.chText: 他们试图取得这个情报被拒。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: They were denied access to the information.

data.chText: 他们无法得到这个情报。
data.enText: Access to the information was denied to them.

data.chText: （尤因道德或宗教原因）节制，克制，戒绝
data.enText: to refuse to let yourself have sth that you would like to have, especially for moral or religious reasons

ex.enText: He was denied entry to the country.

synonyms.bx: 指不允许某人拥有某物或做某事。

ex.chText: 我夫人谢绝了格林太太的晚宴邀请。
ex.enText: My wife declined Mrs. Green's invitation to dinner.

ex.chText: 布朗先生虽然很穷，却谢绝了慈善团体的一大笔捐款。
ex.enText: Poor as he was, Mr. Brown declined a large sum of money from the charity.

ex.chText: 我们同意让他搭车，但是他却谢绝了。
ex.enText: We agreed to offer him a lift but he declined.

synonyms.bx: 指婉言谢绝他人的帮助、邀请等。

ex.chText: 她断然拒绝了他所有的友好表示。
ex.enText: She rebuffed all his offers of friendship.

synonyms.bx: 指很不友好地拒绝别人善意的建议或帮助。

ex.chText: 她拒绝一个人到那里去。
ex.enText: She refused to go there alone.

ex.chText: 她叫他一起来，但是他拒绝了。
ex.enText: She asked him to come with her, but he refused.
He refused a second cup of coffee.

ex.chText: 这个建议太好了，让人难以拒绝。
ex.enText: The suggestion seems too good to refuse/turn down.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指拒绝做某事或接受别人所给之物，作后者解时常可与turn down 换用。

ex.chText: 他对要求他辞职的呼声置之不理。
ex.enText: He rejected calls for his resignation.

ex.chText: 我弟弟因为视力不好未能参军。
ex.enText: My brother was rejected by the army because of his poor eyesight.

synonyms.bx: 指拒绝接受或考虑某事，或指由于不能让人满意而不接受、不录取等。

example: She denied that she had taken money

tr: deny formally (an allegation of fact by the opposing party) in a legal suit

example: he denies her her weekly allowance

tr: restrain, especially from indulging in some pleasure
example: She denied herself wine and spirits

tr: refuse to grant, as of a petition or request
example: The dean denied the students' request for more physics courses
the prisoners were denied the right to exercise for more than 2 hours a day

value.def: When you deny something, you state that it is not true.

example.tran: 她对两项指控均予以否认。

example.ex: The government has denied that there was a plot to assassinate the president...
example.tran: 政府否认曾有人密谋暗杀总统。

example.ex: They all denied ever having seen her.
example.tran: 他们全都否认曾见过她。

value.def: If you deny someone or something, you say that they have no connection with you or do not belong to you.

example.ex: I denied my father because I wanted to become someone else.
example.tran: 我和父亲断绝了关系，因为我想成为一个不一样的自己。

value.tran: 否认与…有关系;否认…是自己的;不承认;抛弃

value.def: If you deny someone something that they need or want, you refuse to let them have it.

example.ex: If he is unlucky, he may find that his ex-partner denies him access to his children...
example.tran: 如果不走运的话，他可能会发现前妻拒绝让他接近自己的孩子。

example.ex: My mother denied herself for us.
example.tran: 妈妈为了我们在生活上一贯节制。

value.boxu_tran: 不要混淆 deny 和 refuse。deny 表示否认某事属实：The allegation was denied by government spokesmen (政府发言人否认了这一指控)。deny 亦表示拒绝给予某人某物：I never denied her anything (我对她百依百顺)。refuse 表示有意不做或坚决表示不做某事：people who refuse to change their opinions (拒绝改变看法的人)，He refused to condemn them (他拒绝谴责他们)。refuse 亦表示拒绝接受别人主动给予的东西：The patient has the right to refuse treatment (病人有权拒绝接受治疗)。refuse还可表示拒绝给予某人其所要之物或不允许某人做其想做之事：He can run to Dad for money if I refuse him (如果我不给他钱，他可以跑到爸爸那儿去要)。
value.boxu_usage: Do not confuse deny and refuse. If you deny something, you say that it is not true. The allegation was denied by government spokesmen. If someone denies you something, they do not allow you to have it. I never denied her anything. If you refuse to do something, you deliberately do not do it, or you say firmly that you will not do it. ...people who refuse to change their opinions... He refused to condemn them. You can refuse something that someone offers you. The patient has the right to refuse treatment. If someone does not allow you to have something you ask for, or to do something you have asked to do, you can say that they refuse you. He can run to Dad for money if I refuse him.
